In a quaint little town, there existed an ancient clock that hung in the town square. Unlike any ordinary clock, this one could speak. Every hour, it would chime melodious verses that shared tales of the townsfolk, weaving their joys and sorrows into poetic lines. One day, a lonely girl named Lila sat beneath it, wishing for a friend. The clock noticed her sadness and chimed softly, “Dear child, the world is vast, yet here you are, a treasure untold.” Encouraged, Lila began to share her dreams, and the clock became her confidant, bridging her heart to the townspeople who soon gathered, drawn by its enchanting words.
